website_summaries.verdict: Despite some limitations, the Instant Switch is an easy and affordable upgrade for existing iDevices setups.
pros: The iDevices Instant Switch is a snap to set up, and it offers an easy way to set up a three-way switch without any additional wiring
cons: The Instant Switch only works with other iDevices products, and can't control third-party HomeKit gadgets
It can't trigger scenes or groups of devices, either

customer_reviews.title: Great, when it works.
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it's great. The problem is it doesn't always work. I'll often tap it and get the red LED which will not end up talking to the wall plug. This usually takes a two or three attempts to correct. I've tried removing and re-adding it, different plugs, and none of it helps. Pros: fits standard wallplate Cons: Very finicky—often does not work on first or second try If this became a little more reliable and added HomeKit (surprising absence in the iDevices lineup), this product would increase a star or two.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Jones

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup; doesn’t work consistent
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to have a physical switch to control my outdoor idevices plug. The setup was flawless. However the button would work (roughly) thirty percent of the time. Certainly not fun to try and turn lights on or off unsuccessfully and have to pull your phone out anyway. Alexa works about 95 amd this is their own product. Strange. Looked for a firmware update because I thought there’s no way this can be this bad but alas no fw update available. Pros: easy and flawless setup. Cons: it doesn’t activate the switch when you press the device; it doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: Jason P.

customer_reviews.title: I think this product is great. Although I was disappointed by it being limited ...
customer_reviews.text: I think this product is great. Although I was disappointed by it being limited to one iDevice product, I was able to combine actions through Homekit. Now when I turn one light off, another follows with very minimal delay. Problem solved. I also appreciate the slim design and standard gang sizing. I just increased the size switch plate and have a very clean look - couldn't tell that it is not hardwired. Setup was relatively easy once I realized that it only paired with one device.
customer_reviews.author: DGK721

customer_reviews.title: Limited bluetooth range makes some installations unusable.
customer_reviews.text: Blue tooth range is very limited. If using this for three or four way installation, switches will have to be close to the the primary switch or the bluetooth connection will be lost and instant switch will be unusable. Only two instant switches can be paired to a wall switch or dimmer switch. This is the same for pairing wall switches with each other. A maximum of three devices can be used in any installation.
customer_reviews.author: Bart C. Meltzer

customer_reviews.title: Controls one hardware device very well...not any software driven operations.
customer_reviews.text: Great products. I have several with an Apple connection. This product specifically does like the others, exactly what they say it will do and does it reliably. You should know it operates an iDevices product like they say. Read into that it will NOT operate a Scene, Trigger or anything else. If you have 4 switches connected to turn on the lights in your room, for example, it will turn on one of them, but not all 4. They don’t say it will...so I’m not complaining. Just reminding you when you plan your system you should keep that in mind.
customer_reviews.author: NoNamesAtAll

customer_reviews.title: Works... eventually.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two, because I have 2 iDevices plugs. After pairing, the Instant Switch turns its associated plug on. After waiting a bit and hitting it several times, the Instant Switch turns its associated plug off. And so on. I don't know if I'm just not hitting the Instant Switch in the sweet spot, or if it just needs to juice up before sending a signal, but it's not fast. Other than that, they turn iDevice plugs on and off. 3 stars for doing the job, but slowly and poorly.
customer_reviews.author: M. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfect for what I needed. Installed this along with an iDevices socket (which also works great) and they paired immediately. The toggles are a little soft, but the response and function make up for it. Works definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Nice in Theory - it does not work!!
customer_reviews.text: The battery discharged quickly and had to be replaced within one month. The switch is in the same room as the iDevices wall switch it is paired with and keeps dropping the blue tooth connection. It is physically located within 50-60 feet with no other obstructions than the box the wall switch is mounted inside. Blue tooth radio connection is at best unreliable.
customer_reviews.author: George C.

customer_reviews.title: Its not a smart thing whats so ever
customer_reviews.text: Its not a smart thing whats so ever.. it does what it should do but really in a way that is so far from intuitive. The flat nature of the switch makes it super hard to know what u r doing
customer_reviews.author: mohammad karam

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Straightforward
customer_reviews.text: helped me add a switch to an iDevices product for even easier use.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk B.

customer_reviews.title: Slick idea but to limited.
customer_reviews.text: I saw the purchase 3 deal and bought them hoping to add wireless light switch to HomeKit. I was confused when I got them because the box does not list HomeKit compatibility. Reading the instructions it only works with an iDevice. I tried to add it to the iDevice app and it will not even add it to the app if you do not have the appropriate iDevice to control. What a huge disappointment. Do not buy until they free this device to work as we expected.
customer_reviews.author: Budd

customer_reviews.title: Dumbest smart switch
customer_reviews.text: Only connects to one device. Have to use IFTTT to use as a switch for multiple lights...IFTTT is very unreliable
customer_reviews.author: OneZero

customer_reviews.title: Not an apple product
customer_reviews.text: Several questions regarding why it doesn't work with apple's home kit or other smart home modules. Answer, it is not made by Apple but an independent company.
customer_reviews.author: Cessna Guru

product_meta.title: iDevices IDEV0020 Instant Switch, Wireless, Works with iDevices Products Only, White
product_meta.description: With an additional way to effortlessly control your iDevices products, it's never been easier to add flexibility to your smart home. Place the iDevices Instant Switch anywhere in your home without the need to run wires and connect your entire living space with our diverse ecosystem of smart products. The Instant Switch also has a dimming feature, giving you the ultimate freedom to create the perfect ambiance anywhere in your home.
feature_bullets: No Wiring: Install the Instant Switch in seconds with the included Command Strip from 3M
Connect In Seconds: The Instant Switch quickly pairs with compatible iDevices products using Bluetooth technology (Instant Switch not compatible with iDevices Thermostat)

Flexible Control: Add 3- and 4-way functionality anywhere when paired to the iDevices Wall Switch or the iDevices Dimmer Switch; create switched control of plug-in accessories when paired with the iDevices Wall Outlet

Seamless Install: The Instant Switch includes a small custom faceplate. It can also be installed with any standard sized rocker faceplate to match existing switches, standalone on the wall, directly in a gang box, or next to an existing gang box so as to blend seamlessly with any home's decor
iDevices : The iDevices Instant Switch is backed by a 2-year limited and our 100% U. S. based customer experience team
